html: 5.24.17  10:35 am   why are you such a workaholic?

5.24.17  10:32 am   In response to the question about you being identified as a YouTuber, I'm not so sure that it's a phase. YouTube is one of the biggest platforms out there,

     so unless something emerges that is even bigger than YouTube,

      I think you will always be called a YouTuber. What are your thoughts?

5.24.17  10:00 am   Question about HOTEWIG; I was just curious as to why you left out a lot of modern stuff having to do with the Middle East. Like I understand that you wouldn't want to go super recent like covering the Arab Spring or events in Syria, but events in Iraq and things such as the Iranian Revolution are seemingly important things to world history you never covered. So I guess my question is, why not?

5.24.17  4:10 am   hey, how do i get over my bad singing? i play guitar, compose on the computer and dabble in piano but my voice is shit. i realized that very few people actually care about the techincal side of a composition so they only appreciate the singing. and since my singing is bad im sad.

5.24.17  3:47 am   hey bill this question im about to ask is very important to me because i struggle with lack of productivity? how do you stay so productive? i was convinced that you were procrastinating on HOTEWIG but you were actually making it as fast as you can all year, while also probably working a normal job (idk ur financial situation). also, some videos of yours indicate that you can be lazy (i dont wanna clean my room),

     but still you overcome it and are productive? How? Is it just a matter of finding what you want to do most in life? Any tips? thabks!

5.24.17  3:38 am   I'm fairly certain that songs like "i can play" have some deliberately ridiculous statements, but you can never be too sure. Are the emotions and thoughts in your songs 100% true and accurate to yourself?
5.24.17  3:16 am   What do you value more, your sense of humour or your musical sense?

5.24.17  2:55 am   I've always wanted to get good at piano improv but I've been intimidated by the thought of learning a buttload of scales. is there a way to learn to improvise well without having to get comfortable with how scales work first? I've never been good at learning scales because the technical side of music is a mystery to me. is there a way to learn scales through osmosis
